# Vantel - AI Software for Commercial Insurance Brokers
We help commercial insurance brokers automate 50% of their manual workflows, enabling them to focus on higher-value tasks like building new client relationships.
**Love Redin**
[Vantel](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/vantel>)
21 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Vantel+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0AVantel+-+AI+Software+for+Commercial+Insurance+Brokers.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMgu-vantel-ai-software-for-commercial-insurance-brokers>)
Embed
<https://vantel.ai/>
#ai#b2b#saas#fintech#insurance
**TL;DR**
Commercial insurance brokers spend 80% of their time on manual, repetitive tasks like policy analysis, manual data entry, documentation, billing and administration. Vantel builds AI software that automates these workflows, **currently helping brokers save 10+ hours per week**. Our first product lets brokers compare five 100-page insurance policies across 50 factors in 5 minutes instead of 5 hours.
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9ybGwHNyi90>
**The Problem: Commercial Insurance is Extremely Manual**
Almost every company needs insurance. Most companies do not have the competency in-house to know exactly what coverage they need. Because of this, they often hire a commercial insurance broker to advise them on insurance-related matters.
After interviewing 100 commercial insurance professionals, we discovered some of the largest challenges in the industry: documents and workflows are unstandardized, there are multiple parties involved, and high-quality data is hard to collect. This results in **commercial insurance brokers spending the majority of their time on highly manual processes** :
  * Comparing policy documents
  * Validating insurance requirements in contracts versus policies
  * Regulatory documentation of advisory work
  * Compiling claims data from multiple sources into a common format
  * Translating complex material from carriers to a digestible format for the client


**Our Solution: AI-Powered Workflow Automation for Brokers**
Vantel is building an AI platform that automates the most time-consuming tasks for commercial insurance brokers. We have started with:
**1. Policy Comparison**
  * Compare 5 policies in 5 minutes (versus 5 hours if done manually)
  * Works with any carrier and policy type, instantly recognizing differences and key terms
  * Ranks policies based on coverage quality


**2. Contract Validation**
  * Cross-check insurance requirements in contracts versus policies
  * Identifies gaps in current coverage, to avoid hidden risks
  * Enables more extensive client service – this is currently a high-touch activity


**Why Now?**
With recent advances in LLMs, we are creating a product that was impossible to build 12 months ago. During our conversations with brokers, we have learned that **it is absolutely possible to build a revolutionary product in commercial insurance in just a few months**. The feedback we’re getting from brokers is giving us an incredible conviction that we’re on the right track. It is amazing to see their jaws drop when they realize countless hours of work can be automated with our software, freeing up time to serve more clients.
**Team**
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87228&key=user_uploads/1763011/7b86fe12-d8c8-4bbd-98e1-8e2551d3d8fd)
  * [Love Redin](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/love-redin/>) (CEO) - Previously data scientist at venture-backed startups and McKinsey/QuantumBlack, venture capital investor, software engineer at Sweden’s largest independent asset manager, and claims adjuster at Scandinavia's largest insurer prior to university. Arctic Army Ranger with background in engineering physics and pure mathematics from KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden.
  * [Ulme Wennberg](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/ulme-wennberg/>) (CTO) - Founded several startups, ex-Microsoft software engineer, and 800+ research citations within NLP. Machine learning PhD dropout and first-principles thinker. Pursued parallel studies in Engineering Physics at KTH Royal Institute of Technology and Business and Economics at Stockholm School of Economics. Graduate studies at the University of Washington, including co-authoring one of the most impactful information extraction papers of 2019, and building conversational agents with Amazon Alexa.


**Our Ask**
If you are (or know!) a commercial insurance broker looking to save 10+ hours per week on manual processes to spend more time with your clients, we would love to show you what we're building – please reach out to us at founders@vantel.ai.

# Nitrode: AI-Assisted Game Development Platform
The platform that makes any developer be able to make games using AI
**Ben Kim**
[Nitrode](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/nitrode>)
19 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Nitrode+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0ANitrode%3A+AI-Assisted+Game+Development+Platform.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMiJ-nitrode-ai-assisted-game-development-platform>)
Embed
<http://nitrode.com>
#ai#gaming#consumer#generative_ai#developer_tools
**Intro**
[Nitrode](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/nitrode.com/>) is an AI-assisted gaming platform designed to transform your gaming development experience. If you’ve ever wanted to build a game, Nitrode empowers you to effortlessly build, launch, and play your favorite games. Leveraging AI, Nitrode streamlines the game creation and launching process, allowing creators to focus on their vision without getting bogged down by mechanics or technical complexities.
**The Problem**
The complexity of current game engines presents a significant barrier for aspiring developers, often discouraging them from pursuing the creation of high-quality games despite their passion and creativity. These engines typically require a deep understanding of programming, sophisticated designs, and the ability to navigate complex interfaces, making the development process overwhelming. This high level of difficulty forces game development to be a niche area for developers - preventing many developers from creating games they enjoy.
**The Solution: Nitrode!**
With Nitrode, playing and creating games go hand in hand. Our platform offers a seamless and intuitive space for gamers to discover and play, while our dedicated creation engine (built off of Godot) provides powerful tools to simplify game development and launch. With features such as world generation, code-assist, and a new interface, every developer is now a game developer.
<https://youtu.be/MW3Z9wysIX8>
**The Team**
[Ben](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/ben-yoonsung-kim/>), [Richard](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/linkedin.com/in/rgu0114>), and [Brian](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/linkedin.com/in/brianyla>) studied IS and CS respectively at Cornell. [Sejoon](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/linkedin.com/in/sejoonchang>) studied CS and Product Design at Stanford. Ben and Sejoon have been friends since middle school, and Ben, Brian, and Richard have been roommates since freshman year of college.
Ben - Minecraft and Brawlstars aficionado—always down for a game of bedwars or a game of ranked brawl stars.
Brian - Your average Tetris enthusiast—perpetually trying to find new t-spin setups.
Richard - Chronically on Pokemon Go raids—keeping an eye out for a shiny Mewtwo.
Sejoon - Civilization and Sim City BuildIt strategist—orchestrating global domination.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87315&key=user_uploads/1654263/9dd9b958-fce6-4ebd-929b-69ad2147d483)

Name: Archon
Headline: We help software companies sell to government.
Description:
Government IT purchases account for 20% of the U.S. software market. Archon's SDK helps software companies sell to the government by cutting the federal compliance timeline (called FedRAMP) down from 16 to 6 months and cuts costs by $1M per company. 

Our product improves government efficiency and increases competition in this traditionally restrictive market by making compliance cheaper and more accessible for small tech companies.

Email us at inquiries@archon.inc
Tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:govtech; industry:b2b; industry:compliance; industry:automation; location:san-francisco-bay-area
Founder1_Description:
CTO of Archon. Previously advised the U.S. AI Safety Institute at Ai2, edited international law to protect open source development at the UN, and shaped tech policy in 10+ states with the Paragon Fellowship.

Studied for a MS in CS & BA in Politics at Penn.
Founder2_Description: CEO of Archon. Previously a tech policy analyst at the U.S. Department of State, informing diplomats on trends in AI, Quantum, and VR/XR. Originally a software engineering consultant building MVPs quickly for small businesses. Studied CS at Georgia Tech.

# Archon: Fast-track selling software to government
Get the cybersecurity requirements you need to sell software to government.
**Sam Jung**
[Archon](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/archon>)
15 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Archon+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0AArchon%3A+Fast-track+selling+software+to+government.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMjS-archon-fast-track-selling-software-to-government>)
Embed
<https://archon.inc>
#b2b#govtech#compliance#automation#artificial_intelligence
We’re George and Sam—co-founders of Archon, and former government staffers.
**TL;DR:** Our free-to-integrate SDK gives you all the cybersecurity requirements you need to sell to government faster and cheaper. This saves companies $1M (2/3rds of the cost) and reduces the timeline from 16 to 6 months.
**Problem: The government software market is locked behind an opaque, million-dollar compliance process (called FedRAMP) that favors big incumbents with lots of time.**
**Solution:** Our SDK provides compliant-out-of-the-box implementations of all the compliance features you need to sell to government – authentication, logging, access control, etc. You can integrate it into your existing codebase in a week, and we handle all of the obscure compliance restrictions so you don’t have to.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87386&key=user_uploads/2110890/2caad249-0936-4910-9a4e-12ad4425e4f5)
If you want to sell your software to government agencies, start exploring our SDK [here.](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/archon.inc/docs>)
**We condense the FedRAMP process into 4 steps.**
  1. Integrate our free SDK (what we’re launching today)
  2. Self-serve onboarding; then we prepare your 700-page security package
  3. Get an audit
  4. Wait for the Federal authorization board to approve your audit


A typical Series A startup spends $1.5M on consultants and 1.5 years on the first 2 steps. Archon’s SDK cuts the integration timeline down to 1 week. We also know many startups that never sold their software to the government because the barrier was just too high. **Yet, the government’s IT spending accounts for 20% of the entire U.S. software market.** It’s our mission to eliminate these compliance hurdles and bring much-needed innovation from small tech to the federal sector.
![](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXcz8xKiHOkcrclWYcEfAY2gc_hB1s4NlkbyEpQMLR9RNfngWF5EKYxG6N7b67Ix_5A7xxplmqU3xUvP65S-RAl4BSWsBuHJ0sy1duVwFAvZXXZ7xTPG9XPF4LZufVFMc5eQ-a-qrQ?key=gLGrgddQZLJJWptIH4zDOWpy)
**Context:**
We came to YC planning to build AI agents that would speed up government workflows. But, we realized that we’d be spending more of our time on government compliance, than on our actual product. Currently, companies seeking FedRAMP certification face two bad options: spend millions of dollars on consultants, or use loophole solutions that lock them into unfavorable terms. We're building the solution we wish existed - a straightforward path that helps software companies build lasting government partnerships.
**Team:**
  * **George Parks:** Advised diplomats on emerging technologies at State.
  * **Sam Jung:** Previously at State, advised the U.S. AI Safety Institute.


# **OUR ASK:**
  * **Anyone looking to sell software to the government, or get FedRAMP** , we’d be grateful for an introduction. Email us at founders@archon.inc
  * **If you want to sell to government, what technology do you use?** Our SDK is only available for NodeJS to start. Let us know what tech stack you use with [this form.](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/forms.office.com/r/m5vPfmqVP3>)

# a0.dev: Build Mobile Apps in Minutes
Generate, preview, and refine your app—all in one place.
**Seth Setse**
[a0.dev](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/a0-dev>)
14 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=a0.dev+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0Aa0.dev%3A+Build+Mobile+Apps+in+Minutes.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMjx-a0-dev-build-mobile-apps-in-minutes>)
Embed
<https://a0.dev>
#design#generative_ai#developer_tools#artificial_intelligence
Hey everyone, we’re [Seth](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/x.com/sethsetse>) and [Ayo](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/x.com/TheDonAyo>) and – co-founders of [a0.dev](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/a0.dev>)
**tl;dr**
[a0.dev](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/a0.dev>) is the fastest way to build React Native apps.
We generate the **entire front end** of your app for you—navigation, state management, and UI screens, all set up and ready to go.
Need to prototype a single screen instead? We also built a Component Generator, like **v0 but for React Native** , so you can quickly create and export screens with clean, production-ready code. Check out a quick demo video👇.
<https://youtu.be/GXVqQHJCCac>
# **The Problem:** _Building Apps is Hard_
Launching a mobile app is much harder than releasing a website. Setting up your project, coding every screen, managing state, and integrating the backend can take **weeks**.
And if you’re building for iOS, you need a Mac to run Xcode, deal with provisioning profiles, and compile your app—just to test it.
[**a0.dev**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/a0.dev>) removes these barriers. We generate your app’s front end in minutes and let you preview it right away—no Mac, no complicated setup, no waiting.
# **Our Solutions:**
**#1 Full App Generator –** Build a complete React Native app
[a0.dev](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/a0.dev>) takes care of the entire front end of your mobile app—so you can go from idea to working UI in minutes.
✅ **Instant App Generation** – Describe your app, and we generate a complete React Native project with navigation, state management, and essential UI screens.
✅ **Live Preview & Hosting** – Share your app instantly with anyone, no need for TestFlight or manual builds. We host your app so you can test and iterate faster.
✅ **Remote Development Environment** – Work on your app from anywhere via an SSH-powered cloud IDE, with real-time reload and collaboration.
🚀 **Faster to Market** – We’re proving that high-quality mobile apps can be built in record time. We both shipped fully functional apps to the App Store in **under 24 hours** using [a0.dev](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/a0.dev>).
**Check out our demo** where we made a chess timer app in <10 minutes.
[**https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G_upRVS63Fk**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=G_upRVS63Fk>)
**#2 Component Generator –** Like **v0, but for React Native**
Already have an app or need to quickly prototype a single screen? Our Component Generator lets you create custom React Native UI screens in seconds.
While our focus is on building entire apps, our component generator helps you iterate and test ideas **faster than ever.** Try it out [here](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/a0.dev>).
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87417&key=user_uploads/1607594/35f5044d-d40a-4dba-8fb7-71ef8ffddc7c)
**Our Story & Vision**
We started as indie app developers, making side income with apps generating up to $14k MRR. But we realized how hard it was for others to do the same. Our goal is to make mobile app development even easier than building websites. We want more people to be able to make a living creating and selling their own software. [a0.dev](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/a0.dev>) is the platform we wish we had when we started—and now we’re building it for you.
**Our Ask**
  * If you’re a mobile app developer who wants to make a new app or an aspiring app developer looking to enter the scene, contact us and try a0, we’ll help you create and launch your app in < 3 days.


**Get Started**
  * Try our Component and Full App Generator at <https://a0.dev>
  * Follow our journey on X: <https://x.com/a0_dev>


_Need to reach the founders?_
Email: **founders@a0.dev**

Name: Mecha Health
Headline: Trustworthy medical image reporting with AI.
Description: Mecha Health is pioneering the future of radiology report generation through advanced AI technology. Our mission is to streamline the reporting process, enhance accuracy, and improve patient care. Unlike black-box solutions, our AI technology is built with transparency at its core. Every decision and suggestion made by our system can be traced and understood, giving clinicians complete confidence in their AI-assisted reporting workflow.
Tags: industry:machine-learning; industry:computer-vision; industry:health-tech; industry:healthcare; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area
Founder1_Description: Medical doctor @Imperial, where I gained entry to the most competitive deanery in the country. Microsoft PhD scholar in machine learning @UCL - I have more than 20 peer reviewed publications in medicine, digital healthcare, and machine learning - including first author publications in top AI venues such as ICLR. 360+ citations on google scholar. Ex Research Scientist at the Center for Artificial Intelligence @AstraZeneca. Building the future of automated radiology @Mecha Health.
Founder2_Description: Mathematics (BA) and Physics (MSc) graduate from the University of Cambridge, ranking top 30 in the university. British Physics Olympiad participant, ranking in the top 11 in the UK. Former ML interpretability research scholar (MATS), where I was the first in the world to use Sparse Autoencoders on vision models. My research has been cited by Anthropic and Google DeepMind. Currently working on building state of the art radiology report generation AI in a way that is interpretable and safe.
Founder3_Description: I am a Machine Learning & Medical Imaging PhD candidate from University College London (UCL). During my PhD I published work at tier-one Machine Learning venues (NeurIPS, ICML & ICLR), and was invited to present my work at international medical imaging conferences, Digitas, & Harvard Medical School. Before this startup I was poached by my Professors from UCL including the Head of Computer Science to be CEO for their spin-out. Currently building Radiology 3.0 by Automating reporting.
Founder4_Description: ex-ML Engineer across multiple medical device startups, with experience in FDA and CE marked medical devices, as well as LLM safety in healthcare. My PhD in Medical Imaging (UCL) focussed on surgical vision; my work has been patented, cited 100+ times, and published across the world's highest impact scientific venues (NeurIPS, ICLR). Currently building safe and interpretable radiology automations for the future @Mecha Health

# Mecha Health 🩻 Trustworthy medical image reporting using AI
Automated analysis of medical images that is accurate and interpretable.
**Nina Montaña Brown**
[Mecha Health](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/mecha-health>)
a month ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Mecha+Health+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0AMecha+Health+%F0%9F%A9%BB+Trustworthy+medical+image+reporting+using+AI.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMeX-mecha-health-trustworthy-medical-image-reporting-using-ai>)
Embed
<https://www.mecha-health.ai/>
#ai#healthcare#health_tech#computer_vision#machine_learning
**TLDR;** Mecha Health helps radiologists save time and effort by producing draft reports of medical images using AI. **The Problem: Too Many Scans Not Enough Doctors.** Due to a shortage of experts, US radiologists have to read 100 - 250+ studies per day, and this means that 55% have reported high levels of burnout. Additionally, patients sometimes have to wait days to receive medical reports for their scans due to backlogs. At times, this can result in preventable patient harm. **Our Solution: Accurate & Interpretable Medical Image Analysis.** We improve the reporting process by producing draft reports with AI and have invented new science to do this both accurately and safely. Our system can trace every finding to its visual source in the image and evidence each finding with examples from the training dataset. This allows for transparent reporting that doctors can trust.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87081&key=user_uploads/2272824/2dd6b41e-c6f1-46a8-b932-678f32885952)
**Our Background: Frontier Scientific Expertise.** We are leading researchers in machine learning and medical imaging having published in tier-one AI venues (NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML). [Nina](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/nina-monta%C3%B1a-brown-6aa24b133/>), [Ahmed](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/ahmed-abdulaal-5b8b6a295/>) & [Deji](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/ayodeji-ijishakin-b6208b1a9/>) crossed paths through University College London’s Medical Imaging PhD program. [Hugo](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/hugo-fry-825828271/>) met the team after he published AI research that was cited by Anthropic. Ahmed, a trained medical doctor from Imperial College London, witnessed firsthand how reporting delays harm patient outcomes—driving Mecha Health’s mission to transform radiology.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87081&key=user_uploads/2272824/0785d872-c2c8-4a5f-ae6b-f06069c9ec95)
**Our Ask: Intros to Pioneering Medical Professionals and Healthcare Executives.** Please reach out to the team at ahmed@mecha-health.ai if you know any tech-forward clinicians, radiologists, radiology practices, or healthcare executives who could benefit from our technology. You can also check us out at <https://mecha-health.ai/>.
**Watch our full product video here** [**https://youtu.be/s5uJS7S8EF4**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/youtu.be/s5uJS7S8EF4>)

Name: Pig
Headline: An API for automating Windows apps with AI
Description: Pig is an API to launch and automate Windows desktops. Pig's SDK tools plug into your agent loops to allow them to navigate UIs and integrate with software that doesn't have an API.
Founder1_Description: Founder and CEO at Pig.dev. Previously founded Banana.dev, a serverless GPU platform where we hosted production-critical inference jobs for more than 3,000 AI teams. Later joined our competitor Modal.com as a Growth Engineer. I also run ultras!

# Pig 🐷 - Automate Windows apps with AI
Pig is an API for automating workflows in Windows applications.
**Erik Dunteman**
[Pig](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/pig>)
25 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Pig+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0APig+%F0%9F%90%B7+-+Automate+Windows+apps+with+AI.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMfp-pig-automate-windows-apps-with-ai>)
Embed
<https://pig.dev>
#generative_ai#developer_tools#cloud_computing
# TL;DR
[Pig](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/pig.dev>) is an API for launching and interacting with Windows virtual desktops.
Teams building automations can plug Pig into their AI agents, giving them the ability to operate computers as humans would, and perform high-value automations that were previously not possible.
[Sign up here](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/pig.dev/alpha>)
# The Problem
Many enterprise tools, from electronic health records to manufacturing supply-chain apps, are desktop-based and do not have a public API, preventing automation.
Traditional hardcoded RPA automations can be brittle. Subtle changes in the desktop apps, like popups or slow loading, can derail an automation. And complex workflows which require planning and judgment are not possible.
As a result, human office workers are employed to do highly repetitive tasks, often involving transferring text between different desktop apps, spreadsheets, and emails.
# Our Solution
[**https://youtu.be/xGli0TG7s3Y**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/youtu.be/xGli0TG7s3Y>)
In this example, we show what’s possible building on Pig. We start a virtual desktop on Pig, and hand the connection to an agent loop running the [Claude Computer-Use](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/build-with-claude/computer-use>) model.
The model then has a high-level task, and it begins to work, using Pig’s human-mimicking APIs such as:
  * Screenshotting the desktop screen
  * Clicking at coordinates
  * Entering keystrokes


All of which are enough to complete the task.
The Pig SDK gives you tools to manage VMs and send interactions to the desktop.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87161&key=user_uploads/265552/2aeb8c0e-a0a0-47df-a59c-f23218d651b6)
And importantly, Pig includes tools for agents to pass control to human operators during critical operations, such as clicking send on important emails, inputting payment information, or solving captchas.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87161&key=user_uploads/265552/d4cec1ed-390a-4ba1-8c48-b5d5173e9668)
We intend to be the personal computers for AI, and the embeddable observability window for your end users.
# Use Cases
Killer use-cases of Pig involve the following factors:
  * the workflow requires a Windows desktop app
  * The app does not have a public API


I expect to be surprised by what people build on Pig, but I’m most optimistic for use of:
  * Office Suite
  * Electronic Health Record Software
  * Claims Processing Software
  * Factory Control Systems
  * Lab Software


# Team & Background
I’m Erik, a second-time founder, with five years spent building cloud infrastructure.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87161&key=user_uploads/89898/6b51d5af-79d8-4d30-ad7e-f3e221dd3b53)
Most notably, I built [Banana](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/banana.dev>), a serverless GPU product used by more than three thousand teams to host production inference jobs.
Prior to Banana, I built a cloud desktop product for accelerating 3D design apps. Following Banana, I had the privilege to work with our former competitor, [Modal](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/modal.com>), on their serverless Python cloud.
Why am I building Pig?
Throughout 2024, I spent my time experimenting with new technologies and building up a thesis for what the future of AI tooling would be. After poking around a few wild ideas (such as data centers in space and internet-over-laser), I boomeranged back to the area that I know and love: compute infrastructure.
An AI founder friend called me up in Nov 2024, pitched me on this idea as something he needed to see in the world, and said, “Erik, you’re the single best founder to build this.”
And I agree. I am.
# How to become a user
Pig just launched our Alpha program, in which I work directly with early users to get their automations live on Pig.
Sign up at [**pig.dev/alpha**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/pig.dev/alpha>) and I’ll reach out when Pig is ready for you!
And if you don’t need Pig, please tell at least one friend about it.
Oink! Erik
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87161&key=user_uploads/265552/70b01c11-9da9-4db0-976c-1162ca31f323)

# Browser Use: Open Source alternative to OpenAI Operator
We enable AI to control your browser.
**Gregor Zunic**
[Browser Use](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/browser-use>)
21 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Browser+Use+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0ABrowser+Use%3A+Open+Source+alternative+to+OpenAI+Operator.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMh9-browser-use-open-source-alternative-to-openai-operator>)
Embed
<https://browser-use.com>
#automation#open_source
Hey everyone, we're Gregor and Magnus we are excited to launch Browser Use Cloud!
# What is Browser Use (Cloud)?
We started this project 3 months ago because it simply wasn’t possible to use the Browser with any LLM. We thought “How hard could it be to build the interface between LLMs and the web?” Fast forwarding 3 months, we have combined 25k ⭐ on Github and our Open Source community is growing fast.
Four days ago, OpenAI launched Operator. Since then, our community has been asking non-stop for a hosted version of browser-use. So we shipped that. Now you can use Browser Use as a B2C chat tool at <https://cloud.browser-use.com/>. We are releasing the API in the next few days. If you need API access for web agents, call us, don’t wait for the Open AI Operator API to be released!
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87243&key=user_uploads/1367312/bc5949c1-a906-4131-a621-d7da318dda1a)
# Existing problems
During many conversations with our discord community of 5000 people, we identified these core challenges in browser automation:
  * Websites change, and this breaks automation scripts. You usually only notice this, when it's too late.
  * Websites often catch bots. To avoid this, you need to use different IP addresses, solve captchas, and act more like a human.
  * Many people get frustrated with rate limits, parsing errors and API key management, when they do LLM-based scraping.
  * The most useful tasks often require you to log in. This can be a pain, especially if you have to type in your username and password every time.


[Browser Use hosted version](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/cloud.browser-use.com/>) addresses these challenges by handling proxy rotation, maintaining persistent sessions - so you only need to login once, and allowing you to run as many instances in parallel as you need. We've priced it at $30/month, significantly lower than Operator.
On the open-source side, browser-use remains free and flexible. You can use any LLM you prefer - from Gemini to Sonnet, Qwen, and even DeepSeek-R1. It comes with an MIT license and full customisation options.
This week, we're working on follow-up questions, task reruns, voice mode, and scheduled agent starts. If you want to build automations directly into your products call us, we are happy to explore your use cases and help you set get set up with the API or even custom integration.
**Our vision is simple** : tell your computer what to do, and it gets it done.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87243&key=user_uploads/1367312/1ac17208-7147-4696-aa13-7e67a4be8329)
We'd love to hear from you. What automation challenges are you facing? How do you think people will interact with computers in the future?

Name: Fira
Headline: Financial research assistant for investment firms
Description:
Fira is a financial research assistant that helps analysts at investment firms instantly extract and analyse data from unstructured reports of public and private companies. It reads thousands of integrated unstructured financial reports (often 300 pages) to provide source-cited answers, verifiable financial calculations, and Excel-ready tables — tasks that typically take hours.

We're initially focusing on boutique investment banks and small private equity firms, covering annual reports of international companies and allowing to upload custom documents. As we develop our product and build clients' trust, we'll eventually integrate directly into clouds.

Using accurate extraction and analysis as single unit of work LLMs do, our vision is to scale it with agents to allow deeper and more thoughtful research, report generation and task execution — allowing financial teams to focus on ideas and decisions.
Tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:generative-ai; industry:b2b; industry:market-research; industry:ai-assistant; location:san-francisco-bay-area
Founder1_Description:
CTO at Fira. Previously, co-founded and engineered resume.io (+26 local sites cv.dk, cvapp.es, cvapp.mx, ...) 
Scaled from 0 to 45M+ users, $50M ARR. Got acquired by Talent Inc in 2021. Post-acquisition, launched career.io, largest career-services platform.

Open-source dev, author of wouter - React router with 7k stars and 300k downloads/mo. Design Engineer. MSc (Math & CS)
Founder2_Description: CEO at Fira. Previously founded on-chain user analytics startup Hashscan and created crypto portfolio tracker app Hodler that was sold.
markdown:

Fira saves financial analysts' time by searching, analysing, and citing thousands of
UK company filings.

Value

Accelerate your research with instant, accurate and source-linked insights instead of spendings hours on digging through filings.

Product

## Start your research

Fira uses AI specialized in finance to analyze thousands of integrated UK company filings. It gives you exact data and numbers you can trust, with direct links to source documents, delivering higher accuracy than ChatGPT.

Analyse financial breakdowns

Perform general research

Extract financial metrics

Features

## Useful features saving hours

From quick data extraction to deep research, Fira helps you analyse companies faster and more accurately.

![Explore FTSE 100 companies](https://firaresearch.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Ffeature-comps.10c332b9.png&w=3840&q=75)

Join financial analysts who use Fira to do more research in less time.

Name: Orbital Operations
Headline: Moving customers in space with a reusable, high thrust vehicle
Description:
Orbital Operations is developing a high thrust space vehicle that is refuellable and stays in orbit to ferry customers beyond low earth orbit (LEO). This allows satellite customers to take advantage of the low cost, low lead time, and low effort launches to LEO and have us rendezvous with them in space to transport them to their final destination.

Our high thrust and high efficiency is made possible by a unique cryogenic fuel management system being implemented on the vehicle to keep propellants cold so they don't boil. This allows us to use the same propulsion systems that have been developed by launch vehicles over the last few decades (NASA, SpaceX, Blue Origin, Relativity Space, ect.).

Ben and Ross met while working together at Relativity Space, where they qualified the cryogenic flight termination valves for the Terran 1 rocket and continued working together on the heat exchangers and turbomachinery for the AeonR engine.

We are currently working on the first demo of our unique cryo management system and intend to launch an operational vehicle by 2027.
Founder1_Description:
Ross is the Co-founder and COO of Orbital Operations.

He has spent his entire career in the aerospace industry, from Aerojet Rocketdyne, to Blue Origin, and most recently Relativity Space, where he owned all turbomachinery manufacturing and assembly for the Aeon-R engine. He was also responsible for the Flight Termination System test and qualification program for the TM-1 rocket.

Ross has deep expertise in complex manufacturing processes, assembly, test, and chemical propulsion development.
Founder2_Description:
Ben Schleungier is the Co-founder and CEO of Orbital Operations.

He started his career at NASA in propulsion before moving on to SpaceX and then as an early employee at Relativity Space. He owned the fluid systems for the TM1 rocket, the complex heat exchangers on the AeonR engine, and built the Components team and the Integrated Design and Analysis teams from the ground up.

Ben has an deep understanding of rocket engine design and analysis and building high performance engineering teams.

## Meet your newAI employees

## Luna

## Intake Specialist

## New client intake

When a new client calls in, you **want** Luna to pick it up for you. She gathers deep, rich information about the client’s matter while making the caller feel special and heard.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees.png?fit=800%2C450&ssl=1)

## Book consultations

If a new client is qualified, she urges them to book a consultation. On average, she converts 94% of qualified callers to book a **paid** consultation.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/3.png?fit=768%2C432&ssl=1)

## Forwards callers

She forwards callers to the appropriate attorney when needed and knows how to specifically handle new clients, existing clients, opposing counsel, and judges.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-3.png?fit=800%2C450&ssl=1)

## Multilingual

She’s just as good in **20+ languages.** Unlock new channels for clients and save on translators.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-10.png?fit=768%2C432&ssl=1)

## Bob

## Case Analyst

## New matter email

Once Luna passes off the information that she gathered on the phone, Bob sends you an **executive summary email** with contact info, priority level, case summary, and more.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-5.png?fit=768%2C432&ssl=1)

## Case prioritization

You’re busy, and have more people than you can help seeking your services. When callers call in with new matters, you want to **know who to respond to first**. Bob tells you who and why.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-4.png?fit=800%2C450&ssl=1)

## Client Information

He sends you a short and simple synopsis of the caller’s information, clarifying for you which pieces of info he’s sure about and which ones are left unconfirmed by the caller.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-6.png?fit=800%2C450&ssl=1)

## Case summary

Bob compiles the most relevant details from Luna’s call so that you can decide what to do about the incoming matter.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-7.png?fit=768%2C432&ssl=1)

## Jess

## Client Manager

## Closes clients

Jess **is a closing powerhouse.** She uses one simple trick to make that happen: consistent, personalized follow-up. She weaves in the lead’s fears and goals with success stories and key differentiators about your firm.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-13.png?fit=768%2C432&ssl=1)

## Scheduled reminders

Jess makes sure that **clients show up**. She reminds clients of upcoming meetings and tasks that they need to act on, and clients can ask her questions and reschedule times.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-9.png?fit=800%2C450&ssl=1)

## Keeps clients engaged

Jess **keeps clients engaged.** She delivers the type of client care and customer service that you’ve always wanted your staff to do.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-8.png?fit=768%2C432&ssl=1)

## Schedules meetings

When clients ask Luna to schedule a meeting, Jess finds an empty time in your calendar and then checks with you, so you can decide how you want to spend your time.

![](https://i0.wp.com/caseflood.ai/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Meet-your-new-AI-employees-11.png?fit=800%2C450&ssl=1)

Name: ReJot
Headline: Sync engine to enable reactive backends for cross-team integrations
Description:
At ReJot, we're building a synchronization engine to modernize sharing data between backend services within larger organizations. Traditional approaches for internal data transfer such as HTTP requests and event streaming require significant effort to implement and maintain. The biggest hurdle however, is the coordination required to get teams to start the actual integration work.

Our approach is based on synchronization, teams define what data their backend publishes and requires, and we'll make sure everything is reactively up-to-date. By being declarative about integrations, project management overhead as well as technical integration burdens are avoided. ReJot uses your existing infrastructure such as Postgres and Kafka.
Founder1_Description: CEO & Co-founder at ReJot, previously worked on a distributed financial platform at Adyen. Interested in the relation between distributed data and software maintainability.
Founder2_Description: CTO & Co-founder at ReJot, former Data Platform Engineer at Adyen, interested in distributed systems and database technologies.
markdown:
# Integration through Synchronization

Synchronization engine to enable reactive backends for cross-team integrations

[Contact Us](https://rejot.dev/contact/) [About Us](https://rejot.dev/about/)

![YCombinator logo](https://rejot.dev/yc-y.svg)Backed by Y Combinator

## Define


Teams own their data like they own their code. Data owners define a contract, add transformations,
and apply access control rules. Ownership leads to autonomy and speed.


## Integrate


Integrators find data in the catalog. They create derived data from it to enhance their products.
Deep integration creates a cohesive platform.


## Synchronize


ReJot's synchronization engine moves data between teams as soon as it's created. Manual data
fetching and integration tasks are a thing of the past.


* * *

## Use Cases

Examples of how _integration through synchronization_ can help you.

Deep Product Integration
Local-First SoftwareBackend-For-FrontendData Migrations

## Deep Product Integration

At enterprise scale, data is often siloed leading to poor integration between products.
ReJot lets teams expose the operational data created by their product in a data catalog.
Other teams are able to enhance their products with that data. Deep data integration leads
to a more cohesive user experience for the products in your platform.

## Local-First Software

Build responsive frontends that work offline. ReJot can synchronize data from your catalog
directly (or with transformations) to frontend applications. This enables super fast
interactions and live collaboration between users.

## Backend-For-Frontend

Consolidate data from multiple services into a single service that can be consumed by your
frontend. Simplifying the data retrieval and transformation processes.

## Data Migrations

Seamlessly migrate your data between different database systems or schemas while maintaining
data integrity and avoiding downtime. Use ReJot to model new data schemas and migrate to
them while ensuring:

- Zero Downtime
- Data Integrity
- Rollback Safety

* * *

# Benefits

Your organization will benefit from ReJot in these ways.

## Operate as One Platform


Deeply integrate all aspects of your product catalog to create one cohesive platform.


## Fearless Product Evolution


Empower teams to change their product and implementation without worrying about dependent business
units.


## Boost Developer Productivity


Speed up development cycles by cutting down on repetitive integration tasks. Define your data
contracts, and we'll make sure there are no breaches.


* * *

## Say goodbye to...

# Project Management Overhead


Let your product managers focus on talking to users instead of talking to other teams.


# Data Silos


Data is most useful when it’s available to everyone. Publish data seamlessly without compromising on
control & autonomy.


# Reverse ETL


Combine data directly in the operational layer using the catalog of contracts. Stop abusing your data
warehouse.


* * *

## How we integrate

### Bring-your-own-infrastructure


We integrate with the databases you already use and communicate using the infrastructure
that is already present. We don’t force you to integrate with yet another data store,
instead we extract the most out of what you already have.


### Your data, your network


ReJot operates using either a hybrid or self-hosted deployment model. Critical data never
has to leave your infrastructure.


## An Essay on the Burdens of Data

Data is valuable to organisations, but also a burden to software engineers. This essay
is core to the philosophy of ReJot, it explores how to unburden software engineers while
extracting value from data.

[Read the essay](https://rejot.dev/blog/essay)

# Get in touch

Let us know how we can help you!

[Contact Us](https://rejot.dev/contact/)

\- or -

# Get notified

Receive email updates from ReJot

Sign Up

# Bild AI – Read and Understand Blueprints using AI
AI that saves builders from late nights drawing on blueprints.
**Roop Pal**
[Bild AI](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/bild-ai>)
7 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Bild+AI+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0ABild+AI+%E2%80%93+Read+and+Understand+Blueprints+using+AI.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMmV-bild-ai-read-and-understand-blueprints-using-ai>)
Embed
<https://www.bilds.ai>
#ai#b2b#construction#architecture#computer_vision
# **tl;dr**
Bild AI reads construction blueprints and extracts material and cost data for builders. Our software automates the $50B/year spent on manual blueprint processing. Watch our demo [here.](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/youtu.be/Brj5QnphFxg>)
# **The Problem**
Working with construction blueprints to get material and cost estimates is a manual process, involving drawing on blueprints by hand. This is time-consuming and prone to human error, which can lead to tens of thousands of dollars in losses per project. It bottlenecks builders and suppliers from winning new contracts as they’re bogged down with the tedious process of bidding. There are massive manual estimation and bidding teams in-house and outsourced.
# **Our Solution**
We're bringing construction blueprints into the present with artificial intelligence. Bild AI ingests blueprint files and applies computer vision models and large language models to calculate detailed material quantity and cost estimates for flooring, doors, hardware and more. Our first clients are using Bild AI to bid on 10x more projects, with confidence in the accuracy of the estimates. This is just one application of blueprint processing that our clients use today, but our vision extends to permitting and architecture checks.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87575&key=user_uploads/1759634/96a6ca22-fda3-4175-88f2-e41afa960a10)
# **We are [Housing|Software] Developers**
[Puneet Sukhija](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/puneet-bild/>) built his first house at 16 and has since overseen hundreds of construction projects, experiencing firsthand the frustration of working with complex blueprints. [Roop Pal](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/rooppal/>) started at Google at 19 before moving to Waymo, where he built computer vision models to interpret complex traffic signal patterns for self-driving cars. They are exited founders applying their experience to automate blueprint analysis—helping builders focus on what matters: building.
# **Our Ask**
We’re scaling our sales! Our first clients are flooring suppliers, but we want to help as many builders as possible so you can:
  * **Intro** us to builders, general contractors, manufacturers.
  * **Email** us with thoughts and ideas at [founders@bilds.ai](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/founders@bilds.ai>)
  * **Upload** your blueprints at [www.bilds.ai](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.bilds.ai/?utm_source=ycombinator_launches>)!

Name: Retrofit
Headline: A vintage marketplace powered by AI
Description:
Retrofit is a curated vintage marketplace, making online vintage shopping seamless and enjoyable. We are building AI agents to aggregate the most in-demand inventory from vintage stores nationwide and create detailed, visually compelling listings for each item.

Whether you're a vintage enthusiast or a first-timer you can discover unique sought-after pieces easily. Retrofit makes vintage shopping feel like shopping on Nordstrom— rather than digging through piles of low quality listings on existing secondhand marketplaces. For sellers, Retrofit offers tools to list quickly and to connect their inventory with the right audience on our marketplace.
Tags: industry:consumer; industry:e-commerce; industry:retail-tech; industry:fashion; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area
Founder1_Description: Building a curated vintage marketplace powered by AI. Previously, product @ ecommerce startups and Stanford MBA.
Founder2_Description: We are fixing shopping vintage fashion, curated and personalized for you! Previously, solving Computer Vision problems at Google Pixel Camera and led two pending patents. Before that, Stanford CS

Name: Trata

# DiscovertheNarrativesthatDriveMarkets

The world’s largest database of investment research written by anonymous hedge fund analysts.

January 20, 2025

Announcing our pre-seed round

We are excited to announce that we have raised a pre-seed round from Y Combinator and CIOs/Partners/Senior Analysts from 5+ institutional hedge funds.

## Turn over 10X more rocks in record time

Trata identifies and aggregates “tension points”: the 1-3 key points of debate whose outcome will drive a company’s valuation over the next twelve months. Sourced from verified Analysts who have already done the legwork.

## Product Features

Identify companies that fit any framework

Digest the key points in two minutes

Scan the important parts of public documents

Name: Guse
Headline: The first multiplayer AI canvas
Description:
Guse is the first fully multiplayer AI canvas for individuals and teams to work on research, writing, reports, and decks.

A chat interface excels at straightforward, single-answer tasks, but falls short for more complex, iterative tasks such as compiling reports. 

Existing AI canvas tools offer a slightly better interface but lack any rich doc editor tooling, multiplayer functionality, or a truly great AI copilot experience. This prevents tangible, collaborative work from actually being done. 

A Guse canvas has a rich docs editor built in, full multiplayer, and an AI copilot capable of autonomously web searching, writing, and editing any content on the canvas. Individuals or teams can work, iterate, and collaborate on research, reports, etc. - then instantly export any canvas out to any format (yes, even fully fleshed out slides!). 

If chat was the conversational interface for AI, Guse is the collaborative interface and we look forward to seeing what you use it for. Start your first canvas today at guse.io.
Founder1_Description: Building Guse. Prev. Math & CS @ Penn, MLE @ Alibaba, SDE @ Rails
Founder2_Description: Building Guse. Prev CS/Math @ Penn, Gen AI @ AWS, Research @ Stanford HAI.
Founder3_Description: Building Guse. Prev CS @ Penn, Engineering @ Addepar

# 🪿 Guse: Cursor for Docs
The first docs copilot that goes beyond chat and takes real action to research, write, and edit for/alongside you
**Kevin Lu**
[Guse](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/guse>)
a month ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Guse+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0A%F0%9F%AA%BF+Guse%3A+Cursor+for+Docs.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMdZ-guse-cursor-for-docs>)
Embed
<https://www.guse.io/>
#b2b#documents#ai_assistant#artificial_intelligence
Hi everyone, we’re Kevin L, Bach, and Kevin H; the founders of Guse!
Guse is an AI doc for any task from planning a trip to working on in depth research and reports. Create your first doc at [guse.io](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/guse.io>).
[](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=5L2JEhYMmn0>)
📍 **Why are we working on this?**
On my flight back to Philadelphia this past Thanksgiving break, a lady sitting next to me was working on some sort of a report. She had set up a perfect split screen between her Word doc and ChatGPT, and for 6 hours straight I saw as she would copy over some text, paste it into chat, prompt a few times, copy, paste again, google search a few things, rinse and repeat. We’ve all most likely worked in a similar fashion.
But this is a broken way to do work. If you’re working in a doc, you should have all the tools you need and want right there for you. Moreover, the AI tools you use should be powerful enough to tackle the complexity and nuance of the kind of work being done in docs as opposed to the one off questions chat is better suited for.
Unfortunately, no docs tool (GDocs, Notion, Word, etc.) has built out truly capable AI functionality and so chat is still resorted to as the only option for AI tooling. That is until now.
**🏔️ What is our goal?**
We built Guse to not only ensure you never leave your docs for AI tooling ever again, but fundamentally change the way you work and create on a doc. Guse is not just about putting a chat pane in your doc and calling it a day. You should be able to compile entire reports in seconds, generate content and make edits at the speed of thought, and create “docs” that push the bounds on what a doc should even be capable of.
**🚀 So what can Guse do?**
Here are just a few things you can do within a Guse doc:
  1. Ask our composer tool to **“consolidate the most recent news on the fires in LA, exactly which communities have been affected, and specific detail on damages; include some cited reports and images of the fires”**. Composer will autonomously search the web and create all of this on your doc. Then, all you have to do is click accept or deny on the changes.
  2. Highlight any chunk of text on your doc, then query to ask questions or edit. This is completely inline and right in your editor.
  3. Chat pane supporting GPT-4o, Claude, and real time web search powered by Perplexity. Never leave your docs for a chat tool ever again.
  4. Create beautiful docs with our custom blocks such as tables, cards, callouts, images, videos and more. Composer can also work with and use all of these.
  5. Transform any dock into a slide deck. With a single click, you can turn any Guse doc into a fully designed, put together powerpoint slide deck.


Every doc and folder within Guse is collaborative so just share and begin working at [guse.io](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/guse.io>) :)
**Our ask:**
  * If you have any workflow where you find yourself copying and pasting web results or ChatGPT responses into a doc or just working between ChatGPT and a doc, please give Guse a try.
  * If you've tried Guse out and liked it, hated it, or anything in between please let us know at founders@guse.io

Name: Delineate
Headline: Extract meaningful data from research literature and patents atâ¦
Description:
90% of drug candidates fail despite billions in pharmaceutical R&D. 

Delineate extracts and analyzes data from biopharma research papers and patents at scale, including data trapped in figures and plots. 

Led by Emily (MIT PhD, former Pfizer/AstraZeneca computational researcher) and Jawad (ex-Lockheed Skunkworks AI lead), Delineate has developed custom LLM and computer vision models paired with rigorous QC processes to deliver extremely high quality datasets in a fraction of the time.

By processing 15x more studies than industry standard and reducing months of research into weeks, we're transforming how pharmaceutical companies make evidence based development decisions. 

Delineate has generated $160K in revenue through data contracts with Sanofi and Roche, conducting some of the largest aggregated research studies to date.
Founder1_Description: Co-Founder and CTO of Delineate. Masters thesis in Robotics/AI with 2 research publications. Former technical project manager for high impact digital transformation projects within Skunkworks (Advanced Development) division at Lockheed Martin.
Founder2_Description: Co-founder at Delineate. Previously she was an MIT PhD Candidate in Biological Engineering and worked at Pfizer and AstraZeneca where she focused on applying AI to modeling and simulation for drug development optimization.

# Delineate - Information Overload to Insights in Biopharma
Extract meaningful data from biopharma research and patents at scale
**Emily Nieves**
[Delineate](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/delineate>)
5 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Delineate+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0ADelineate+-+Information+Overload+to+Insights+in+Biopharma.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMo0-delineate-information-overload-to-insights-in-biopharma>)
Embed
<https://delineate.pro/>
#saas#biotech#artificial_intelligence
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87668&key=user_uploads/1994202/81ed81f4-b8e2-4a07-b7c7-70d09ac5b497)
### **TLDR**
  * Delineate extracts and analyzes data from biopharma research papers and patents at scale, including data trapped in figures and plots.
  * We are partnered with two top-10 pharma companies where we are performing some of the largest systematic-review studies ever conducted.
  * For our clients we have increased the number of processed studies by 15x compared to industry standard and reduced the time for certain studies from months to weeks.


### **Problem**
90% of drug candidates fail despite billions in pharmaceutical R&D. Making evidence based decisions is crucial to the success of $2B drug pipelines. However to aggregate evidence across hundreds of research papers and patents can take research scientists months of hard labor.
### **Solution**
Delineate has developed custom LLM and computer vision models paired with rigorous QC processes to deliver extremely high quality datasets in a fraction of the time. By increasing the scale and speed for evidence aggregation, Delineate is transforming how pharmaceutical companies make evidence based development decisions.
### **Demo:**
[**Here is a quick demo of our platform and a sample project:**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.loom.com/share/66a1878825f14eabaeee7f5cf948c9a1?sid=55675f9b-2d71-40d2-afc3-4be5351fc80f>)
### **Ask:**
  * Any introductions to biopharma companies that perform meta-analyses and/or computational analysis workflows.
  * If any biopharma-focused YC companies need assistance, we're happy to help!


# About Us:
led by [**@Emily Nieves**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/bookface.ycombinator.com/user/1994202>) (MIT PhD, former Pfizer/AstraZeneca computational researcher) and [**@Jawad Iqbal**](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/bookface.ycombinator.com/user/1991260>) (ex-Lockheed Skunkworks AI lead)
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87668&key=user_uploads/1994202/20a27c7b-6a42-4af4-953a-2a6d9883c8a8)

Name: Rocketable
Headline: The AI maximalist software holding company
Description:
Rocketable is building a large portfolio of wildly profitable software businesses by acquiring existing products and replacing human teams with AI agents.

Today’s foundation models already possess enough intelligence to automate most of the tasks required to run a profitable software business. In the functions where agents aren’t yet intelligent enough to replace humans, they will be soon.

When every human function required to operate a software product has an AI agent equivalent, the next step will be within reach: operating an entire company with a team of AI agents instead of humans.

But superintelligent agents within each function won’t be enough. To operate a software company with 0 human employees, the agents will need to be directed towards common goals, integrated to collaborate across functions, tuned with feedback loops connected to product metrics, and trained to make resource allocation decisions.

We are creating the tools needed to replace the entire org chart of a software company with a team of AI agents. We are developing these tools by owning the products that we automate, because we know from 10+ years of experience building automated systems with AI/ML that integration is the key to unlocking superhuman performance.
Tags: industry:generative-ai; industry:b2b; industry:workflow-automation; industry:investments; industry:automation; location:san-francisco-bay-area
Founder1_Description:
Founder & CEO of Rocketable. Previously: 10+ years building products and leading teams that automated complex tasks with AI/ML: robotaxis at Cruise, self-driving trucks and ADAS systems at Uber, and an irrigation co-pilot product for farmers at Tule (YC S14). 

I write code, have a degree in design, and build hardware. Co-author on 5 patents related to systems & methods for automating complex tasks with AI.

# Rocketable 🚀 - The AI Maximalist Software Holding Company (W25)
We acquire software products and replace human teams with AI agents.
**Alan Wells**
[Rocketable](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/rocketable>)
a month ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Rocketable+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0ARocketable+%F0%9F%9A%80+-+The+AI+Maximalist+Software+Holding+Company+%28W25%29.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMev-rocketable-the-ai-maximalist-software-holding-company-w25>)
Embed
<https://www.rocketable.com>
#b2b#automation#investments#generative_ai#workflow_automation
Hi all 👋 I’m [Alan](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/x.com/alanwells>), founder of [Rocketable](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.rocketable.com/>).
# tl;dr
I’m building a large portfolio of wildly profitable software businesses by acquiring existing products and replacing human teams with AI agents.
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W80DDvHz_wo>
# The longer version…
I started Rocketable because I think that most of the world is still underestimating the potential of AI.
Even in Silicon Valley, most people assume that humans will maintain a monopoly on the creativity and insights needed to operate a successful software product.
I think that’s extremely unlikely.
I believe the real opportunity lies in assuming there is no job in a software company that can’t be automated by AI, and building from there.
### But why are you acquiring existing products?
I believe acquiring existing products is the key to speedrunning the path to building a single person, billion dollar software company.
By acquiring existing software products that already have customers and revenue, I can focus most of my attention on the challenge of automating those businesses.
By owning the products that I automate, I can ignore the management fiefdoms, data silos, and corporate politics that prevent most companies from maximizing the upside of deploying AI in their business.
By buying increasingly larger businesses, I can force myself to climb the ladder of automation complexity faster than most individual businesses evolve organically.
### So what are you building?
Although it’s obvious to me that today’s foundation models already have the raw intelligence needed to do most of the jobs in a large software company, it’s equally obvious that the tools needed to fully replace the entire org chart of a software company with AI agents do not yet exist.
In addition to being competent within each function, to operate software products with 0 human employees, the agents will also need to be:
  * directed towards common goals
  * integrated to collaborate across functions
  * tuned with feedback loops connected to product metrics
  * trained to make resource allocation decisions


Rocketable needs to build the software that enables all of those things to happen. Building the automation system while also owning the products that it operates allows me to:
  * underwrite the risks of early deployment and minimize the cycle time for experimentation
  * connect automation decisions to the outcomes that matter to the business (profitability, growth, retention) rather than intermediate steps in the process.
  * maximize value captured from automation by keeping the upside in-house


There are also significant opportunities to improve the performance of agents (and the customer experience of products they manage) by re-thinking the approach from first principles and ignoring the assumptions that many AI-enabled vertical SaaS products are built upon.
**For example:** instead of automating the typical customer support workflow you see in most companies (where customers interact with relatively low skill tier 1 customer service agents when they have an issue), why not use AI to scale founder-mode support (empowering your AI support agent with access to source code, production databases, and ability to open a PR that solves a customer problem)?
### What makes you think you can do this?
In 2023, I acquired a small, profitable software business on [Acquire.com](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/Acquire.com>) and started experimenting with using LLMs to automate the business. That experience gave me confidence that with the right approach to automation, there is a clear line of sight to fully automating the operations of a software business.
Prior to working on Rocketable, I spent a decade building products and leading teams that used AI/ML to automate complex tasks. I worked on self-driving cars at Cruise, self-driving trucks and ADAS systems for micromobility at Uber, and an irrigation co-pilot for farmers at Tule (YC S14). Before working on AI-enabled products, I managed traditional B2C and B2B products across web and mobile platforms. I write code, have a degree in design, build hardware, and have also worked on optimizing other complex systems (international supply chains and field operations).
### Maybe you’re not crazy. How can I help or get involved?
**📨 Subscribe to updates:** If you’re interested in following along as I figure out the playbook for running software businesses with teams of AI agents instead of humans, [subscribe here](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/rocketable.substack.com/subscribe>).
**🚰 Help with deal flow:** I’m starting to work on my next acquisition and looking to meet owners of software products that are currently generating $250K-$600K in annual profit who may be interested in selling. If that sounds like you or someone you know, [please contact me here](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.rocketable.com/submit-product>).
**🛠️ Work with Rocketable:** It’s likely that I will need to hire a small team of AI-augmented humans to help build the platform that enables acquired products to operate without employees. If you have the domain mastery and technical skill needed to automate one or more of the critical functions of a software business, [please contact me here](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/www.rocketable.com/apply>).
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87105&key=user_uploads/34777/46dabca1-9d5b-4b20-b82d-5c63127e2f7d)

Name: Promptless
Headline: Automatic updates for your customer-facing docs
Description:
Promptless automatically updates your customer-facing documentation, including tutorials, how-to guides, API specs, knowledge bases, support articles, and blog posts. This content is often one of the first points of contact between your product and its users. Clear, accurate, and up-to-date docs are critical, influencing buying decisions, reducing support overhead, and increasing LTV. 

Providers like Readme and Mintlify effectively host your docs, but keeping them updated remains a serious challenge. Working alongside your hosting provider, Promptless lets you configure triggers so that your docs get automatically updated upon new feature releases, developer support questions, or internal use-case discussions. 

Promptless integrates directly with your organization’s entire knowledge ecosystem – issue trackers, internal knowledge bases, support ticket systems, and more – leading to holistic doc updates without expensive coordination between product, engineering, and support teams. 

With Promptless, documentation becomes a strategic advantage for growth, not a bottleneck or a liability.
Tags: industry:developer-tools; industry:generative-ai; industry:saas; industry:b2b; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area
Founder1_Description: Frances is building Promptless, helping companies keep customer-facing content up-to-date. Prior to Promptless, Frances led product, ML/AI engineering, and LLM ops on petabyte scale at Cloudflare, OneSignal, and Graft. Yale undergrad. Stanford PhD drop-out. Has published LLM research.
Founder2_Description:
Prithvi co-founded Promptless.

Before Promptless, he served as VP of Product & Engineering at Bond, a fintech infrastructure startup acquired by NYSE:FIS in 2023. There he saw firsthand the effort required to maintain hundreds of tutorials and guides and the outsized business impact of world-class documentation.

Prithvi graduated from Stanford in 2015 (B.S. CS, AI track). He was also a 4-time International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) participant, including as the youngest participant in 2008.

# Promptless: An AI teammate that automatically updates your customer-facing docs
Promptless proactively drafts updates to your docs while you ship software and support customers
**Prithvi Ramakrishnan**
[Promptless](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/</companies/promptless>)
13 days ago
[ ](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Promptless+just+launched+on+%40ycombinator%27s+Launch+YC%21%0A%0APromptless%3A+An+AI+teammate+that+automatically+updates+your+customer-facing+docs.+Check+them+out%3A&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ycombinator.com%2Flaunches%2FMkQ-promptless-an-ai-teammate-that-automatically-updates-your-customer-facing-docs>)
Embed
<https://gopromptless.ai/>
#ai#b2b#saas#generative_ai#developer_tools
Hello! We’re Frances and Prithvi, founders of Promptless.
# tl;dr
Docs are integral to a great customer experience, but managing them is a challenging, multi-team effort. The most successful companies recognize that fantastic docs drive adoption and bad ones cause customers to churn. Promptless is already used by fast-growing startups and Fortune 500 enterprises alike to automatically update docs based on feature releases, support tickets, internal Slack conversations, and more. [Get started today](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/gopromptless.ai>)!
<https://www.tella.tv/video/promptless-automatically-update-your-docs-690g>
# The Promptless Approach
**Promptless drafts updates proactively for easy review**
  * Our AI agents monitor your software changes for when a documentation update might be needed, and can be triggered from a Slack conversation in one click. No prompt engineering required—hence the name _“Promptless”_.


**Promptless lives where you work and can be triggered anywhere**
  * Instead of forcing you into yet another platform, Promptless integrates into your Slack channels, Github repos, Notion databases, Jira/Linear issues, Zendesk/Intercom tickets, and CMS platform.


**Promptless-written docs are designed to maximize value to your customers**
  * Promptless is designed to prioritize accuracy, simplicity, and discoverability—ensuring that your customers can be onboarded quickly and can self-support without reaching out to your team.


**Promptless is built for all kinds of customer docs**
  * Whether your docs are product tutorials, help-center articles, or developer guides, Promptless can handle it, and infers the style and structure of your documentation by reading your entire docs site.


![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87446&key=user_uploads/729272/8196d287-25b1-4175-877b-92f03d41cf74)
# How Customers Use Promptless Today
Promptless is designed to be flexible—it can integrate with any docs platform, be triggered automatically from many workflows, and can pull in context from any internal knowledge source. Just a few examples:
[Vellum](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/vellum.ai>) (YC W23) has tons of Slack Connect channels with their key customers—they use Promptless to automatically trigger doc updates whenever their team answers a customer question that should be covered in their public guides.
[Clay](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<https:/clay.com/>) (breakout prospecting super tool) has a product team that publishes biweekly changelogs and a content team that manages their guides—they use Promptless to automatically bridge that gap and draft new and updated guides whenever there’s a product update.
A Fortune 500 company has full-time technical writers, but the context surrounding every change is spread across Linear, Confluence, and Slack–Promptless automatically assembles the relevant context and drafts doc updates for every PR, making every technical writer twice as productive.
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87446&key=user_uploads/729272/0a2388b3-a021-423b-80ba-3dc4d94a23f5)
# Our Team and Expertise
Frances and Prithvi have both run teams where great docs were a critical part of the customer experience. At OneSignal (YC S11) where Frances was Head of Data Science, she saw that docs engagement within the first 24 hours was directly tied to the biggest predictors of customers' lifetime value. At Bond (acquired by NYSE:FIS) where Prithvi was VP of Product and Engineering, he saw the challenging, multi-team effort that it took to maintain great customer docs, and wrote many of the guides himself.
# Try it out!
If your team wants to spend less time maintaining docs and more time building great product and serving customers, email us at founders@gopromptless.ai or book some time on our calendar [booking link.](https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/<http:/cal.com/team/promptless/15m-discovery-call>)
![](https://www.ycombinator.com/media/?type=post&id=87446&key=user_uploads/729272/c0ad621e-2366-4b3a-9c6c-e460fd1634b1)

Name: Cedar
Headline: AI automating intake calls and litigation workflows for law firms.
Description:
Law practice is intellectual work trapped in a mesh of administrative tasks. We’re building AI agents that automate pre-litigation workflows for personal injury law firms. 

From AI voice agents that take the initial client intake call to drafting discovery requests and analyzing responses for motions to compel, new workflows can now be automated with the advent of voice and reasoning models.

Personal injury is a $57 billion market in the U.S. alone, with a contingency fee billing model that incentivizes efficiency (unlike other practices of law billed hourly). In high-quality firms, each attorney can make upwards of 3.5 million per year– saving even 1% of their time is significant. We're working on saving >30% of their time. 

The founders, Jesse and Isabelle, met at Georgia Tech, where they graduated with degrees in Computer Science. They’ve worked on projects together for 4 years, while gaining industry experience as software engineers at LinkedIn, Intuit, Notion, and Figma.
Founder1_Description: CTO @ Cedar (YC W25). Previous software engineer @ LinkedIn, working on messaging features for sales inbound and lead conversion. Previous software engineer @ Figma, working on file infrastructure to build a thumbnail generation pipeline. Previous software engineer @ Notion, working on project management product features for enterprise customers. Studied Computer Science @ Georgia Tech.
Founder2_Description:
Co-founder & CEO at Cedar. Prev Software Engineer at Intuit, wrote software routing thousands of people to CPAs a day, optimising the call flow and matching for client conversion. Also prev Product Management at Bending Spoons. 

B.S. in Computer Science at Georgia Institute of Technology.

Name: Misprint
Headline: Misprint is a data-driven marketplace for graded collectibles
Description:
Misprint is an all-in-one marketplace that solves the biggest pain point in the collectibles world: opaque pricing. Collectors, investors, and hobbyists currently rely on scattered data from auction houses, online forums, and reseller platforms, making it difficult to know the true value of their items. Misprint streamlines the process by combining accurate pricing analytics with a seamless buy/sell marketplace, making it easier than ever to understand and monetize collectible assets.

Existing marketplaces lack robust, real-time analytics because accurate valuations require deep expertise in both the collectibles domain and advanced pricing algorithms. Misprint’s unique blend of insider trading card knowledge and machine learning allows us to fill this gap.

Building these pricing models requires extensive data infrastructure, deep domain expertise, and cutting-edge ML. Recent surges in the trading card market show that collectors crave transparent valuations.

The global collectibles market is worth tens of billions of dollars. Eva has experienced the scale of this industry firsthand, generating $500k ARR within three months of taking her Pokemon card-selling side hustle full-time. With additional segments like sports cards, comics, and emerging collectible categories, the growth runway is immense.

Co-founders Eva and Jon have been best friends since Exeter, combining finance expertise, a passion for collectibles, and mathematical rigor. By merging Goldman Sachs-level financial analytics with top-tier mathematical talent, Misprint is uniquely positioned to become the go-to platform for fair, transparent pricing in the collectibles space.
Founder1_Description:
Eva is the Co-Founder and CEO of Misprint.

She left her role as an Equity Analyst at Goldman Sachs to follow her lifelong passion for trading cards, reaching over $500k ARR within three months just by selling Pokemon cards. An alum of the University of Chicago, she studied Economics and East Asian Languages & Civilizations. Eva has published articles in PSA Pop Culture Magazine and TCGplayer Infinite, and also hosts a trading card-focused YouTube channel, Eva’s Binder.
Founder2_Description:
Cofounder/CTO, Misprint (YC W25)

Jon, a mathematician turned card enthusiast, holds a BS and MS in Mathematics from Carnegie Mellon. While pursuing his PhD, he pivoted to theoretical machine learning, publishing numerous papers and studying high dimensional machine learning problems. Jon left his PhD program to join YC and focus on Misprint, where he applies his technical expertise to build cutting-edge pricing models and analytics, driving innovation in the graded card marketplace.
